image.altText: Four buildings burn at night in a city against a smoke-filled orange sky

props.synopsis: At least 36 people are dead and others remain trapped after a massive fire that engulfed multiple high-rise towers at a residential complex in Hong Kong. Follow live.

title.children: Three arrested on suspicion of manslaughter as high-rise apartment blaze in Hong Kong kills at least 36

image.altText: A police officer stands in front of yellow 'do not cross' tape, which people are gathered behind.

props.synopsis: Two National Guard soldiers have been shot near the White House. Their conditions were not immediately known, according to a law enforcement official who spoke to AP on condition of anonymity.

title.children: Breaking: Two National Guard members shot in Washington DC

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: The platforms, which can be used to make real people appear nude in photos and videos, have been used in several high-profile cases in Australian schools.

title.children: 'Nudify' services used by Australian school students blocked

image.altText: NASA's Perseverance Mars rover taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: Microphone recordings from NASA's Perseverance rover have turned up more than 50 instances of lightning on the red planet over the past four years, a new study finds.

title.children: Sound of lightning captured on Mars — but it's nothing like on Earth

image.altText: A close up of Labor's Anthony Albanese, wearing a navy suit jacket and dark-rimmed glasses.

props.synopsis: The level of the prime minister's reform appetite has been discussed and debated since roughly 9pm on election night in May, when Labor's massive win became clear.

title.children: Tough economic choices lie ahead after Labor's successful year

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking, seen from lower down. The man is surrounded by microphones.

props.synopsis: What does a dead cat have to do with Donald Trump and the Epstein files? Everything, according to some experts.

title.children: The 'dead cat' theory could apply to Donald Trump and the Epstein files

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera while holding a mobile phone up.

props.synopsis: Optus has been under intense scrutiny after a network outage in September left hundreds of people unable to call Triple Zero and was linked to three deaths.

title.children: 'Nightmare' complaint left Optus customer and offshore worker in tears

image.altText: Advertisements for Black Friday sales are seen online on a mobile phone screen

props.synopsis: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

title.children: Black Friday sales 'pressure' pushing some Australians into debt binge

image.altText: Screenshots from a ghost store website.

props.synopsis: With Australians expected to spend billions this Black Friday, the consumer watchdog is warning about a growing number of "ghost stores" targeting unsuspecting shoppers and posing as local businesses promising premium goods, when in reality they are shipping fast fashion from overseas.

title.children: How to spot 'ghost stores' posing as Australian businesses

image.altText: Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen

props.synopsis: Australia has recorded its single largest drop in carbon emissions for a financial year outside of the COVID-19 pandemic. Follow live.

title.children: Australia records single largest emissions drop outside of pandemic

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's records single largest drop in carbon emissions outside of COVID

image.altText: Strips of twisted metal lying on the street in front of shops.

props.synopsis: A man has died after he was struck by a tree during a series of storms that have lashed New South Wales.

title.children: Man killed and 117,000 without power as storms lash NSW

image.altText: Israeli military vehicles

props.synopsis: Israeli security forces have launched what the military described as a counter-terrorism operation in the northern West Bank, which Palestinians said was targeting the city of Tubas.

title.children: Israel launches new military operation in northern West Bank

image.altText: Generic image of a phone displaying a folder of social media apps

props.synopsis: Australia's social media age ban is being challenged in the High Court on the grounds that it restricts young teens' implied right to freedom of political communication.

title.children: Social media ban for under-16s challenged in High Court

image.altText: Jeremy smiling at camera in black shirt

props.synopsis: Jeremy Webb died aged 16 after eating sausages while camping in the Central Coast. Growing up, he was bit by ticks outdoors multiple times.

title.children: Jeremy cooked sausages while camping. He was dead 90 minutes later

image.altText: Sad woman holding frame of child's photo with bear toy on lap.

props.synopsis: Kloe Weedon's son Zeke William Hondow, a schoolboy with a sharp wit and even sharper haircuts, was farewelled at a funeral last week.

title.children: Her 8yo son was killed in an e-motorbike crash. Now she wants new rules to protect kids

image.altText: Collage of musicians with a guitar player and others against a blue background.

props.synopsis: Celebrate Ausmusic T-Shirt Day with our Australian music trivia quiz. How well do you know your local legends?

title.children: Think you know Aussie music? Prove it in our quiz

image.altText: Meg Lanning celebrates a wicket with teammates

props.synopsis: Australia is expecting to see its medal chances boosted at the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad as sports such as cricket and hockey remain in contention to return.

title.children: Aussie stronghold sports in line for Commonwealth Games return in India

image.altText: A group of African soldiers in fatigues and berets sit and stand behind a table as an officer reads from a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: Guinea-Bissau's military says it has seized control of the country and arrested its president following the discovery of a plan to destabilise the coup-prone west African nation.

title.children: Guinea-Bissau military launches coup and arrests political leaders

image.altText: Graphic depicts Darren Lockyer and Ryan Reynolds with rugby league players and the text 'welcome to London'

props.synopsis: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

title.children: Darren Lockyer channels 'Welcome to Wrexham' in bid to promote London club

image.altText: Banana prawns in a plastic bag from the supermarket

props.synopsis: Authorities in the US and Europe have recalled goods as Indonesian authorities investigate the source of radioactive contamination.

title.children: Indonesia launches probe into exports of radioactive goods. Here's what we know

image.altText: A photograph of a brown coloured model of a human brain

props.synopsis: The data showed there is "non-linear change across development" in the brain, suggesting it does not continue on one steady progression throughout your life.

title.children: Study shows there are four pivotal ages in your life for your brain

image.altText: robert irwin and witney carson lift trophies at dancing with the stars finale

props.synopsis: The son of late wildlife conservationist Steve Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars US, lifting the coveted Mirror Ball trophy a decade after his sister won the same title.

title.children: Robert Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars — a decade after sister Bindi

image.altText: Noarlunga Hospital sign

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman is suing a southern suburbs hospital for $1.5 million in damages alleging she suffered a "permanent neurological injury" when doctors failed to diagnose her with a stroke, court documents reveal.

title.children: SA woman suffered permanent brain injury after hospital failed to diagnose stroke, court hears

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, purple tie and white shirt stands speaking behind a lectern decorated with flowers

props.synopsis: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te says the budget was introduced for the country to defend itself in the face of a rising threat from China.

title.children: Taiwan announces $61 billion defence budget to defend itself against China

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff with a football.

props.synopsis: With the vote to decide the fate of the Hobart stadium a week away, Premier Jeremy Rockliff's political legacy is in the balance.

title.children: The way Rockliff will be remembered inextricably tied to Hobart stadium's future

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged blonde woman.

props.synopsis: Detectives have conducted a search near Ballarat as part of the ongoing investigation into the disappearance of Victorian woman Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Detectives search state park for missing woman Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A happy Anthony Albanese and a more serious-faced Sussan Ley in black and white cut outs on a colourful 90s style background.

props.synopsis: Millennials are bucking trends, becoming an increasingly progressive voting bloc and rewriting the long-held rules of politics, writes Isabella Higgins.

title.children: Millennials are the first generation to move left as they age

image.altText: Kotoni Staggs playing for the Kangaroos

props.synopsis: Kotoni Staggs must decide between representing Australia or Tonga at the international level, and says there is one key factor that will tip his decision either way.

title.children: Staggs reveals one condition to ensure he continues playing for Australia

image.altText: Murdered Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court in Cairns has heard that Rajwinder Singh, who is accused of the 24-year-old's 2018 murder, first came to the attention of police because of his blue car, which they later searched.

title.children: Court hears sand found in car of man accused of Toyah Cordingley's beach murder

image.altText: The mugshot of a man looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: More than 100 people were injured at a Liverpool Football Club victory parade in May.

title.children: Ex-Marine pleads guilty to Liverpool FC parade car ramming charges

image.altText: close up of woman in blue check shirt looking at mobile phone

props.synopsis: Amanda's husband always seemed to just know things. When fiddling around with her social media settings, she discovered how he had been using technology to gaslight her.

title.children: Amanda's husband seemed able to read her mind. Then she learnt why

image.altText: Tourists flock to Mather Point at Grand Canyon National Park in the US

props.synopsis: Changes set to take effect on January 1 will include annual park passes jumping to $US250 for foreign tourists, while US residents will continue to be charged $US80, according to authorities.

title.children: US National Parks to raise fees for foreign visitors to popular sites

image.altText: Paul Brereton speaks during inquiry.

props.synopsis: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief executive Philip Reed writes to parliament apologising for inaccuracies in evidence given during Senate estimates.

title.children: NACC chief executive apologises to parliament for inaccurate evidence

image.altText: A good-looking older couple in expensive clothing smile broadly.

props.synopsis: A down-to-earth Scottish woman who preferred to stay out of the spotlight, Ms Templeman was frequently credited by Sir Richard as a stabilising force on his career, providing a counter-balance to his extravagant personality.

title.children: 'Heartbroken': Richard Branson's wife Joan Templeman dies aged 80
